title: Rename the "Dark" and "Light" theme to match the syntax of other preference options
description:
## Problem
We have a dedicated Dark Mode in our navigation themes, but it currently appears like this:

![image](/uploads/f6c41db3b845328b8a47cd8c7ebc1eb1/image.png)

This is confusing, since we already have a pre-existing "Dark" theme. "Dark Mode" changes the whole palette across GitLab, "Dark" only changes the navbar. We should consider using terms that don't overlap as much.

## Proposal

Follow the convention of the other colors and have Gray and Light Gray options.

![CleanShot_2020-08-20_at_10.12.26_2x](/uploads/e579cc7a4c2144ef0f19041eadcd549e/CleanShot_2020-08-20_at_10.12.26_2x.png)

title: Ensure `master` Review Apps are unique and stop them at the end of the pipeline
description:
This was brought to my attention that `master` pipelines all use the same environment name, thus potentially race for the same Review App: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/38253/diffs#note_398782926

Also, the Review App could be stopped at the end of the pipeline since it's not meant to be used by humans.

title: Add tooltip for pipeline type icon to explain its meaning
description:
### Problem to solve

As a user, I want to be able to see what the icon meaning is that shows on my pipelines, so I can clearly understand what they are representing if I am not familiar with them.

This is for the pipeline listing page: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/pipelines

![CleanShot_2020-08-20_at_14.41.49_2x](/uploads/587cbfacd90373b4fc4ef8b83fb02f43/CleanShot_2020-08-20_at_14.41.49_2x.png)

### Intended users

All

### User experience goal

Provide the user more confidence in understanding the information that the UI is portraying.

### Proposal

Provide a tooltip when hovering over the icon to reveal its meaning.
- Add a tooltip with `Merge request`, `Branch` and `Commit` for the MR, branch and commit icon respectively.

title: Pipeline email services `notify_only_broken_pipelines` was changed only for new projects [13.2 Regression]
description:
### Summary

**[13.2 Regression]**

The pipeline-email services API delivers different responses for `notify_only_broken_pipelines` based on when the project was created.

It returns either **true** or **1**.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Look at an old project (< 13.2) where pipeline emails are setup: `https://your-instance/api/v4/projects/<id>/services/pipelines-email`
1. Look at a newly created project

## Old

```
{
  "id": xxxxx,
  "title": "Pipelines emails",
  "slug": "pipelines-email",
  "created_at": "2017-12-01T07:31:23.264Z",
  "updated_at": "2019-07-01T12:11:26.700Z",
  "active": true,
  "commit_events": true,
  "push_events": true,
  "issues_events": true,
  "confidential_issues_events": true,
  "merge_requests_events": true,
  "tag_push_events": true,
  "note_events": true,
  "confidential_note_events": true,
  "pipeline_events": true,
  "wiki_page_events": true,
  "job_events": true,
  "comment_on_event_enabled": true,
  "properties": {
    "recipients": "some-email@localhost.com",
    "notify_only_broken_pipelines": "1",   <---
    "branches_to_be_notified": "default"
  }
}
```

## New

```
{
  "id": xxxxx,
  "title": "Pipelines emails",
  "slug": "pipelines-email",
  "created_at": "2020-08-20T12:21:47.794Z",
  "updated_at": "2020-08-20T12:21:47.794Z",
  "active": true,
  "commit_events": true,
  "push_events": true,
  "issues_events": true,
  "confidential_issues_events": true,
  "merge_requests_events": true,
  "tag_push_events": true,
  "note_events": true,
  "confidential_note_events": true,
  "pipeline_events": true,
  "wiki_page_events": true,
  "job_events": true,
  "comment_on_event_enabled": true,
  "properties": {
    "recipients": "some-email@localhost.com",
    "notify_only_broken_pipelines": "true",
    "branches_to_be_notified": "default"
  }
}
```

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

The API depends differently, based on how old the project is and either returns `1` or `true`.
While I think breaking API changes are fine, these should be consistent at least

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

The `services/pipelines-email` API should **EITHER** return **1** or **true**, not depending on which project is requested.

title: Add search argument when getting issue board epics in GraphQL
description:
When fetching epic swimlanes for an issue board (https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/229149), user can pass various issue filters. One of filters used on current issue boards is a `search` param so only issues matching the search term are listed on the board.

We should allow passing `search` argument in `issueFilters` when fetching board epics too to assure we return only epics for issues displayed on the board.
